programme.desc: When all the Westley Kids but Philly Phil get invited to a popular kid's party Philly Phil becomes determined to figure out exactly what it is about popular kid behavior that he doesn't grasp. The data he compiles on the subject he then uses to build a robot he calls BROC (Big Robot on Campus) which he endows with all the sure-fire popularity attributes he can think of thus making it possible for Philly Phil to ride into popularity on BROC's coattails. Surprisingly Philly Phil's plan seems to work... that is until things start backfiring when BROC begins treating Philly Phil as a social liability and starts scoring popularity points at Philly Phil's expense.

programme.title: Fast & Furious: Spy Racers

When Cleve creates a sandstorm to take out the crew, theyâ€™re saved by two Bedouin brothers named Kareem and Salem (and their pack of camels). Elsewhere in the Sahara, Ms. Nowhere and Gary are captured by Cleve.

programme.title: Recipe for Love
programme.desc: In Onjeong Market, located in Onjeong, a town some distance away from Seoul, the area is buzzing with change as apartment complexes are built and plans for subway extensions and new town developments are announced. Across a single street stand a principled general hospital, Gongmyeongjeongdae Clinic, and traditional Korean clinic, Yangji Barun Clinic. The two families who run these places have been bitter enemies for years, bound by a long standing grudge from an incident in the past. Even the smallest matters turn into big fights, making them the most famous rival families in Onjeong. This is a family growth drama about these two families as they unravel their long held misunderstandings, heal their wounds, learn to love one another, and are reborn as one family.

programme.desc: Foreigners who have left their familiar worlds behind and come to the unfamiliar land of Korea! programme.title: Unkind Ladies
programme.desc: This drama features the women of three generations and people around them. Mari grows up as a good teacher of this generation where there is no true mentor. Hyeonsuk, who has been a troublemaker, realizes the love and support of her family. Kang Sunok regards herself as unlucky, but later on realizes how happy she has been. How can you hold up when your life gets tough? You will figure it out by holding up day by day, just like these women in the drama.

programme.title: Walking On Thin Ice
programme.desc: Eunsoo was an ordinary wife and mother who never broke a rule. But when her husband is given a death sentence by illness, her daughter walks away from school, and the family home is about to be taken, life leaves her cornered. Then, a bag stuffed with drugs falls into her hands like a fate. To save her family, she makes a choice she can't turn back from.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner (S3)
programme.desc: Throughout history, every major civilisation has believed in curses and their power to inflict harm. But if curses are real, then what brings them into existence? And how are they triggered?

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries (S5)
programme.desc: Over seven hundred years ago, a religious order protected a vast treasure of gold, precious gems, and relics... and then it all mysteriously vanished. What happened to the hoard of the Knights Templar?

programme.title: The UnBelievable With Dan Aykroyd (S2)
programme.desc: This episode explores the strangest and most ghastly gigs ever. From night soil men cleaning excrement off the streets of Victorian London to professional mourners hired to weep at funerals!

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner (S3)
programme.desc: All over the world, there are giant monoliths that our ancient ancestors carved out of solid rock. But what was the purpose of these huge stone monuments? Did they serve some kind of ritual function?

programme.title: Eseng Ng Tondo (Digitally Enhanced)
programme.desc: FPJ played Eseng 45, a Manila policeman known for his proficiency with the 45 caliber gun. He was also known to be an honest and dedicated cop, the nemesis of evil in the crime-ridden area of Tondo.

programme.title: Pretty Boy
programme.desc: Andrew E times two doubles the fun in this comedy about mistaken identities and the hilarious results. Andrew played Pretty Boy, a well-known gangster who was dressed in designer suits.

programme.title: Buhay Mo'y Buhay Ko Rin
programme.desc: They're both members of the police force: he's an undercover assigned to crack a notorious syndicate, and she's a traffic officer tasked to manage the city's clogged streets.

programme.title: Campus Girls
programme.desc: Four girls began college together. Along with this new phase in their lives also came major upheavals which nearly wrecked their friendship. The girls discovered that theirs was not a perfect world but there was always hope for tomorrow.

programme.title: Madaling Mamatay, Mahirap Mabuhay
programme.desc: Ronnie played a disillusioned former military officer, who took the job of a school security chief to investigate the mysterious death of his best friend.

programme.title: Sampung Ahas Ni Eba
programme.desc: A plane wreck leaves a woman Eva (Vivian Velez) alone with ten guys in an island. Each fantasizing about herâ€¦ Each wanting herâ€¦ Each willing to kill for her.

programme.title: Burlesk Queen
programme.desc: One of the classics of Philippine cinema wherein screen ingenue Vilma Santos made her transition into matured actress. Into this world came the young girl who becomes its last shining star. But as her presence brought life into the old art, her own existence is endangered by the decaying surroundings.

programme.title: Hulihin Si Nardong Toothpick
programme.desc: Nardo was a simple student cum bank janitor who was accidentally accused of murder and robbery. The truth was, while he really intended to rob the victim, he had a change of heart.

programme.title: Abot Hanggang Sukdulan
programme.desc: The abduction and rape of the eldest daughter shattered the once happy Paredes household. They vowed to get justice for their daughter but changed their plan when Romano offered marriage after it was discovered that Agnes was pregnant.

programme.title: Miss Na Miss Kita (Ang Utol Kong Hoodlum 2)
programme.desc: Together, Robin and Vina, created beautiful music. Together they were in constant danger because of certain people and certain events, which were taking place around them, but they were not aware of.

programme.desc: Pretty Boy Segovia

programme.title: Bitag (Babae At Bala)
programme.desc: Sgt. Nick Nobleza (Jestoni Alarcon) is the straightest cop in the police force. He is assigned to infiltrate the drug syndicate of Mr. Villafuerte. But Mr. Villafuerte is one step ahead as he sets up a trap of his own.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: Two doctors in western Japan have an alter ego as the music duo Insheart, whose songs bring hope to patients and families. We follow them and the fans who find strength and comfort in their music.

programme.title: NHK Newsline

programme.desc: A 15-minute spin-off of the "Somewhere Street" series, "A Short Stroll" explores cities through traveler's eyes. Today, we visit Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar.

programme.title: Biz Stream
programme.desc: Visionary Eye Tech: This episode features technology that turns smartphones into professional-grade eye exam equipment and vision-enhancing glasses designed for people with visual impairments.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Cinematic Journey: Deep Culture
programme.desc: Kyle Card explores the San'in Kaigan Geopark, discovering Yumura's hot springs, Ojiro's hillside rice terraces and heritage Tajima beef, as well as the Oriental White Stork wetlands of Toyooka.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We meet two men in Shimane. In Unnan City, Korean Sanghyun uses local rice to brew makgeolli like it's done in his homeland. In Tamatsukuri Onsen, Nepalese Nandeshwar tends the front desk of an inn.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony #4 Winter
programme.desc: In Uda, discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden, where the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule, a sanctuary of the local culture and history.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Hosono Hitomi's botanically themed ceramics are highly acclaimed and held in museum collections across the world. She talks about her intricate designs and unmatched technique.

programme.title: 1/1800: Stranded On Mountains
programme.desc: A hike can turn unsafe very quickly. In 2023 Japan saw a record high of 2,761 mountain accidents. We follow a veteran hiker lost and injured for six days, revealing how he ultimately survived.

programme.title: 1/19: Elderly People Living Alone
programme.desc: In Japan, 6.7 million or one in 19 seniors aged 65+ live alone. In a remote village, the only grocery shop supports the elderly living alone. We find out why one widowed woman is happiest now.

programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life: Sudden Shower
programme.desc: Caught in an evening shower, Edo townspeople scramble across a bridge in search of shelter. On the river beyond, a lone figure steers his boat, unfazed by the rain. What is his destination?

programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: The temple chefs show us how to make su-no-mono with dried daikon radish. Just mix rehydrated daikon with red radish and sweet vinegar, and this tasty pink-colored dish is ready to serve.

programme.desc: This season as Australian Story marks 30 years we delve into the lives of real people with amazing stories including Indigenous leader and rock star Witiyana Marika, film director Sophie Hyde and '80s adventurer Alby Mangels.

programme.title: Back Roads - Tambo, QLD

programme.title: CNA Correspondent
programme.desc: Donald Trumpâ€™s return to office brought steep US tariffs on India, then an unexpected rollback. What did India learn - and which strategies worked or failed?

programme.title: The Windmill Massacre
programme.desc: Jennifer joins a tour to explore the renowned windmills of the Netherlands. As their tour coach breaks down on the way, they seek refuge in a creepy shed near a sinister windmill with a dark history. When some tour members suddenly disappear, Jennifer discovers a shared secret among them, linking their fates in a chilling revelation.

programme.title: The Ghost Writer
programme.desc: A struggling writer must write a hit novel to save his career. He retreats to his childhood home where his father, also a successful writer, died mysteriously. Upon discovering his father's final manuscript, he realizes it's far superior to anything he could create. He decides to plagiarize the work, setting off a series of horrifying events.

programme.title: Whisper of Silent Body
programme.desc: Renowned as the "corpse whisperer," forensic pathologist Qin Ming uncovers vital clues from the corpses. During a homicide investigation, he unravels a murder case sixteen years ago in the snowy mountain with his assistant and a detective. Together, they unveil the secrets of the mysterious homicide.

programme.title: Sinister
programme.desc: Jia Hao and his friends gather to celebrate his birthday at a villa. However, the festivities take a dark turn when they connect to a deadly VR game in which they must light candles and dodge ghosts to survive. Tragedy strikes as two of his friends fall victim to the escalating horrors within, plunging them all deeper into a chilling nightmare.

programme.title: WaningÂ Moon
programme.desc: Nuanchan is a famous and highly respected spiritual medium in a rural village in Thailand. She wants to train her niece, Ploy, to succeed her and Ploy needs to remain a virgin. When Ploy falls in love with her childhood friend Tul, their lives are in danger as the secret of the spiritual world is being unveiled.

programme.title: An Unquiet Grave
programme.desc: A year after Jamie's wife tragically died in a car accident, he persuades her sister, Ava, to accompany him to the accident site to perform a peculiar ritual. As the night progresses, it becomes evident that Jamie harbours sinister motives.

programme.title: Chapter 1 Mae Nak Reborn
programme.desc: Mae Nak the ghost wife returns to take revenge for a pregnant woman who is sexually assaulted and loses her baby. No one can identify the assailant except Mae Nak, who turns into an evil spirit in order to punish the assailant for his evil deeds.

programme.title: Bunshinsaba: Hoichi the Earless
programme.desc: You Mei brings home an abandoned doll found on the street. Little does she know that it is possessed by an evil spirit which causes the sudden death of her colleague. You Mei seeks help from a ghost hunter who unleashes the pencil spirit to fight against the evil spirit, unfortunately leading to a series of terrifying eventsâ€¦

programme.title: Red Snow
programme.desc: Olivia, an outstanding vampire romance novelist, longs to encounter a real vampire. Her wish comes true when Luke turns up at her remote snowbound cabin seeking for help. However, her dream transforms into a chilling nightmare on Christmas Eve when Luke's vampire companions track him down...

programme.title: #TextMeWhenYouGetHome (S2)
programme.desc: Residents of Robeson, Pennsylvania were stunned when Ashley Kline went missing on New Year's Eve. The 12-day search turned up several suspects until investigators uncovered suspicious text messages.

programme.title: Cold Case Files: Dead West
programme.desc: In the shadow of the Rockies, Carolyn Jansen, 43, is found dead, stuffed into a duct-taped container. Detectives have two suspects but no clear way to tell who is the killer.

programme.title: Women On Death Row
programme.desc: In 1998, a fire in Sandi Nieves' home that started under suspicious circumstances led to her conviction for arson, the murders of her four daughters, and the attempted murder of her son David.

programme.title: First Blood (S1)
programme.desc: African-American women in the Mt Pleasant neighbourhood of Cleveland were vanishing. Their families cried for help, but no one knew what was happening. No one except Anthony Sowell.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder (S1)
programme.desc: When Toni meets Harold at a medical convention, they click and soon marry. But when money starts going missing from Toni's account, suspicion falls on Harold.

programme.title: Murder At The Motel
programme.desc: May 13, 2020, Reno, Nevada. Officers from the Reno Police Department are dispatched to the La Quinta Inn after several motel guests report hearing gunshots in the middle of the night.

programme.title: Witness To Murder: Digital Evidence
programme.desc: After the gruesome murder of an aspiring actor in Georgia, police quickly run out of leads. But a new digital forensic tool breathes new life into the investigation.

programme.title: Taking The Stand (S2)
programme.desc: Curtis Reeves stands accused of murdering Chad Oulson over popcorn at a matinee movie. The defence claims he acted in self-defenceâ€”that Oulson was the aggressor.

programme.title: #TextMeWhenYouGetHome (S2)
programme.desc: Nia Wilson and her two sisters decided to take public transportation back home. But just minutes after texting their father, the sisters were brutally targeted at a train station.

programme.desc: In 2006, Ken Juedes was found dead by his wife, Cindy Shulz-Juedes. For 13 years the case went cold until investigators linked her to the murder.

programme.title: Preschool | Eccd
programme.desc: Learn the characterstics of plants and animals, what they need, and how they grow, as well as the physical properties and movement of objects. Know more about different types of weather and changes in the environment, the concepts of size, length, weight, time, and money, and the sense of quantity and numeral relations.

programme.title: Kindergarten
programme.desc: Learn the characterstics of plants and animals, what they need, and how they grow, as well as the physical properties and movement of objects. Know more about different types of weather and changes in the environment, the concepts of size, length, weight, time, and money, and the sense of quantity and numeral relations.

programme.title: Grade 1 Language
programme.desc: Pag-aralan ang mga salitang magkakatugma, salitang kilos, pang-ukol, at kung paano magsulat ng mga pangungusap nang may tamang baybay at laki ng mga letra.

programme.title: Grade 1 Math
programme.desc: Know more about time and nonstandard units of length, mass, and capacity, as well as pictographs without scales and outcomes of an event.

programme.title: Grade 1 Reading & Literacy
programme.desc: Identify what are action and describing words, how to sort and classify words, and how to follow directions.

programme.title: Grade 1 Makabansa
programme.desc: Alamin ang konsepto ng distansya sa paglalarawan ng sariling kapaligirang ginagalawan tulad ng tahanan at paaralan at ng kahalagahan ng pagpapanatili at pangangalaga nito.

programme.title: Grade 2 Filipino
programme.desc: Aralin ang pagpapantig, pagbibigay ng kahulugan sa mga salita, pagbuo ng mga pangungusap, pagbabasa ng teksto, at kung ano ang mga pang-ukol, pang-abay, at salitang kilos.

programme.title: Grade 2 Math
programme.desc: Understand more about time, standard measures of length, mass and capacity and area through square-tile units, alongside pictographs with and without scales.

programme.title: Grade 2 English
programme.desc: Identify pronouns and prepositions, and how to read, match, and write words that use short vowels.

programme.title: Grade 2 Araling Panlipunan
programme.desc: Pahalagahan ang kagalingang pansibiko bilang pakikibahagi sa mga layunin ng sariling komunidad.

programme.title: Grade 3 Filipino
programme.desc: Matuto tungkol sa pangngalan, panghalip, at iba't ibang elemento ng kuwento, at kung paano magsulat ng kuwento at magbigay ng kahulugan ng mga salita.

programme.title: Grade 3 Math
programme.desc: Know how to convert time, what are the linear, mass and capacity measures, the area of square and rectangle, bar graphs, and outcomes of an event.

programme.title: Grade 3 English
programme.desc: Learn more about adjectives, adverbs, maps, graphs, how to read words, and how to restate facts from texts.

programme.title: Grade 3 Araling Panlipunan
programme.desc: Alamin ang mga gawaing pangkabuhayan at bahaging ginagampanan ng pamahalaan at ang mga kasapi nito, mga pinuno at iba pang naglilingkod tungo sa pagkakaisa, kaayusan at kaunlaran ng mga lalawigan sa kinabibilangang rehiyon.

programme.title: Grade 3 Science
programme.desc: Find out more about people, animals, plants, landforms and bodies of water, and their importance. Discover the types and effects of weather as they relate to daily activities, health and safety, and the natural objects in the sky affect oneâ€™s daily activities.

programme.title: Grade 7 Filipino
programme.desc: Suriin ang iba't ibang akda ayon sa mga tauhan, kaisipan, at saloobin na nakapaloob dito, at alamin kung paano magsulat ng sariling pananaw at ideya tungkol sa napakinggan.

programme.title: Grade 7 Math
programme.desc: Learn the key concepts, uses, and importance of statistics, data collection/gathering and the different forms of data representation, measures of central tendency, measures of variability, and probability.

programme.title: Grade 7 English
programme.desc: Learn how to write and compose essays, and the nature of Philippine literature and theater.

programme.title: Grade 7 Araling Panlipunan
programme.desc: Alamin ang pagtugon ng mga Asyano sa mga hamon ng pagbabago, pag-unlad at pagpapatuloy ng Silangan at Timog-Silangang Asya sa transisyonal at makabagong panahon (ika-16 hanggang ika-20 Siglo).

programme.title: Grade 7 Science
programme.desc: Discover the relation of geographical location of the Philippines to its environment, the different phenomena that occur in the atmosphere, the relationship of the seasons and the position of the Sun in the sky, and the occurrence of eclipses.

programme.title: Als
programme.desc: Learn about the process of planning, setting up, running a small business, and entrepreneurial skills.

programme.title: Grade 5 Filipino
programme.desc: Alamin kung paano magbigay ng mga mahalagang pangyayari, paksa, at opinyon tungkol sa napakinggan o nabasang teksto, kung paano wastong magbaybay ng mga salita at maglarawan ng tagpuan at tauhan.

programme.title: Grade 5 Math
programme.desc: Learn more about area, volume, temperature, line graphs, and experimental probability.

programme.title: Grade 5 English
programme.desc: Analyze visual and multimedia elements and learn how to write paragraphs and articles.

programme.title: Grade 5 Araling Panlipunan
programme.desc: Pag-aralan ang bahaging ginampanan ng kolonyalismong Espanyol at pandaigdigang koteksto ng reporma sa pag-usbong ng kamalayang pambansa patungo sa pagkabuo ng Pilipinas bilang isang nasyon.

programme.title: Grade 5 Science
programme.desc: Know how weathering and soil erosion shape the Earthâ€™s surface and affect living things and the environment, weather disturbances and their effects, the phases of the Moon, the beliefs and practices associated with it, and the constellations with the information derived from their location in the sky.

programme.desc: Identify pronouns and prepositions, and how to read, match, and write words that use short vowels.

programme.title: Grade 2 Araling Panlipunan
programme.desc: Pahalagahan ang kagalingang pansibiko bilang pakikibahagi sa mga layunin ng sariling komunidad.

programme.title: Grade 3 Filipino
programme.desc: Matuto tungkol sa pangngalan, panghalip, at iba't ibang elemento ng kuwento, at kung paano magsulat ng kuwento at magbigay ng kahulugan ng mga salita.

programme.title: Grade 3 Math
programme.desc: Know how to convert time, what are the linear, mass and capacity measures, the area of square and rectangle, bar graphs, and outcomes of an event.

programme.title: Grade 3 English
programme.desc: Learn more about adjectives, adverbs, maps, graphs, how to read words, and how to restate facts from texts.

programme.title: Grade 3 Araling Panlipunan
programme.desc: Alamin ang mga gawaing pangkabuhayan at bahaging ginagampanan ng pamahalaan at ang mga kasapi nito, mga pinuno at iba pang naglilingkod tungo sa pagkakaisa, kaayusan at kaunlaran ng mga lalawigan sa kinabibilangang rehiyon.

programme.title: Grade 3 Science
programme.desc: Find out more about people, animals, plants, landforms and bodies of water, and their importance. Discover the types and effects of weather as they relate to daily activities, health and safety, and the natural objects in the sky affect oneâ€™s daily activities.

programme.title: Grade 5 Filipino
programme.desc: Alamin kung paano magbigay ng mga mahalagang pangyayari, paksa, at opinyon tungkol sa napakinggan o nabasang teksto, kung paano wastong magbaybay ng mga salita at maglarawan ng tagpuan at tauhan.

programme.title: Grade 5 Math
programme.desc: Learn more about area, volume, temperature, line graphs, and experimental probability.

programme.title: Grade 5 English
programme.desc: Analyze visual and multimedia elements and learn how to write paragraphs and articles.

programme.title: Grade 5 Araling Panlipunan
programme.desc: Pag-aralan ang bahaging ginampanan ng kolonyalismong Espanyol at pandaigdigang koteksto ng reporma sa pag-usbong ng kamalayang pambansa patungo sa pagkabuo ng Pilipinas bilang isang nasyon.

programme.title: Grade 5 Science
programme.desc: Know how weathering and soil erosion shape the Earthâ€™s surface and affect living things and the environment, weather disturbances and their effects, the phases of the Moon, the beliefs and practices associated with it, and the constellations with the information derived from their location in the sky.

programme.title: Grade 8 Filipino
programme.desc: Suriin ang iba't ibang akda ayon sa mga elemento nito, paano magpahayag ng sariling paniniwala, at kung ano ang malikhaing pagsusulat.

programme.title: Grade 8 Math
programme.desc: Identify the key concepts of inequalities in a triangle, parallel and perpendicular lines, and probability.

programme.title: Grade 8 English
programme.desc: Know more about different sources of information, grammatical signals, communicating skills, and writing paragraphs.

programme.title: Grade 8 Araling Panlipunan
programme.desc: Alamin ang kahalagahan ng pakikipag-ugnayan at sama-samang pagkilos sa kontemporanyong daigdig tungo sa pandaigdigang kapayapaan, pagkakaisa, pagtutulungan, at kaunlaran.

programme.title: Grade 8 Science
programme.desc: Learn about the digestive system, its interactions with other body system, diseases resulting from nutrient deficiency and harmful substances, how cells divide to produce new cells, meiosis, species as a concept, and the one-way flow of energy and the cycling of materials in an ecosystem.

programme.title: Preschool | Eccd
programme.desc: Learn the characterstics of plants and animals, what they need, and how they grow, as well as the physical properties and movement of objects. Know more about different types of weather and changes in the environment, the concepts of size, length, weight, time, and money, and the sense of quantity and numeral relations.

programme.title: Les Quiquoi
programme.desc: Olive, Petole, Boulard, Mixo, Raoul and Pamela make up a full-of-fun gang known as the Quiquoi. Together they ask a host of existential questions, using drawings to find the answers. In their own quirky way, they love nothing better than creating surrealist worlds where everything becomes possible.

programme.title: Les Croquemoutard
